channel.description: Recent content in Networking Tips on Technical Book

item.title: IP Precedence And TOS | DSCP
item.description: Intro # 8 Bits of Type of Service in IP Header. IP Precedence # RFC791/RFC1349 Interpretation ** Bits ** 7-5 IP Precedence 111 Network Control 110 Internetwork Control 101 Critic/ECP 100 Flash Override 011 Flash 010 Immediate 001 Priority 000 Routine Bits 4 (1 = Low Delay; 0 = Normal Delay) 3 (1 = High Throughput; 0 = Normal Throughput) 2 (1 = High Reliability; 0 = Normal Reliability) 1 (1 = Minimise monetary cost (RFC 1349)) 0 (Must be 0)

item.title: TCP Congestion Control
item.description: Intro # TCP is a protocol that is used to transmit information from one computer on the internet to another, and is the protocol Iâ€™ll be focused on in this post. What distinguishes TCP from other networking protocols is that it guarantees 100% transmission. This means that if you send 100kb of data from one computer to another using TCP, all 100kb will make it to the other side. This property of TCP is very powerful and is the reason that many network applications we use, such as the web and email are built on top of it.
